title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 2.

questions.question: What was the offering made of when anyone brought a meat offering unto the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 states that the meat offering shall be of fine flour.

questions.question: Who did the person bring the meat offering to?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron's sons the priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2 specifies that the offering shall be brought to Aaron's sons the priests.

questions.question: What did the priest do with the handful of flour, oil, and frankincense?
questions.correctAnswer: Burn it upon the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2 says the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar as an offering made by fire.

questions.question: True or False: The remnant of the meat offering belonged to Aaron and his sons.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:3 states that the remnant of the meat offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'.

questions.question: If the meat offering was baked in the oven, what kind of cakes were offered?
options: Unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:4 explains that the oven-baked meat offering shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil.

questions.question: True or False: Leaven and honey are allowed in any offering of the LORD made by fire.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 states that no meat offering shall be made with leaven or honey, and none shall be burned on the altar.

questions.question: What must be added to every oblation of the meat offering as a seasoning?
questions.correctAnswer: Salt
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 commands that every meat offering shall be seasoned with salt.

questions.question: Where does the priest burn the memorial of the meat offering?
questions.correctAnswer: Upon the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:9 says the priest shall burn the memorial upon the altar.

questions.question: What is placed on the meat offering along with oil before it is brought to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Frankincense
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 and 2:15 both mention placing frankincense on the meat offering along with oil.

questions.question: What kind of flour is used for the meat offering baked in a frying pan?
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:7 specifies that the meat offering baked in a frying pan is made of fine flour with oil.

questions.question: What happens to the firstfruits offered unto the LORD?
options: They shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour
They are completely burnt on the altar
They are eaten by the priests only
They are given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:12 explains that the oblation of the firstfruits shall be offered to the LORD but not burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'No meat offering which ye shall bring unto the LORD shall be made with ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Leaven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 states no meat offering shall be made with leaven.

questions.question: What is done with the part of the beaten corn, part of the oil, and all the frankincense in the firstfruits meat offering?
options: The priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar
It is eaten by the priests
It is given to the poor
It is stored in the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:16 describes the priest burning these parts as a memorial unto the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: The salt of the covenant of God must not be lacking from the meat offering.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 commands that the salt of the covenant of God must be present in all offerings.

questions.question: How is the meat offering prepared if baked in a pan?
options: Fine flour unleavened mingled with oil
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour unleavened mingled with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:5 states that a meat offering baked in a pan shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to maintain integrity in their worship. Based on Leviticus 2, what is essential to include in a meat offering to show faithfulness and obedience?
options: Fine flour with oil and frankincense
Any type of bread with salt
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour with oil and frankincense
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 instructs that the meat offering must be of fine flour, with oil poured upon it and frankincense added, emphasizing obedience and faithfulness in worship. Verses 2:2 and 2:15 also confirm these elements are essential in the offering.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 2 teach about the importance of offering the firstfruits in a way that honors God?
options: Offer green ears of corn dried by fire with oil and frankincense
Burn the entire firstfruits offering on the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Offer green ears of corn dried by fire with oil and frankincense
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:14-15 teaches that the firstfruits must be green ears of corn dried by fire, beaten out, then anointed with oil and frankincense. This shows reverence and gratitude in the offering, not burning all on the altar (2:12).

questions.question: A believer is confused about whether leaven or honey should be included in offerings. Based on Leviticus 2, what biblical principle about purity and holiness would you share?
options: No leaven or honey shall be included in any meat offering made by fire
Leaven and honey are acceptable in offerings if they are burned on the altar
Leaven is allowed but honey is forbidden
Honey is allowed but leaven is forbidden
questions.correctAnswer: No leaven or honey shall be included in any meat offering made by fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 explicitly forbids the inclusion of leaven and honey in any meat offering made by fire, emphasizing the importance of purity and holiness in worship and obedience.

questions.question: How does this chapter teach us about the significance of salt in our spiritual devotion and covenant relationship with God?
options: Every meat offering must be seasoned with salt, symbolizing the covenant with God
Salt is optional in offerings and represents prosperity
Salt should only be used in offerings of firstfruits
Salt is forbidden in all offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Every meat offering must be seasoned with salt, symbolizing the covenant with God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 states that every meat offering must be seasoned with salt, called the salt of the covenant of God, symbolizing faithfulness and lasting commitment in the believer's relationship with God.

questions.question: If a believer is unsure how to present their offering to the church, what practical instruction from Leviticus 2 would you share about the role of the priest in the offering process?
options: The offering is brought to the priests, who burn a memorial portion on the altar
The believer burns the entire offering themselves
The offering must be hidden from the priests
The priests eat the entire offering immediately
questions.correctAnswer: The offering is brought to the priests, who burn a memorial portion on the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2 and 2:9 explain that the believer brings the offering to the priests, who take a memorial portion and burn it on the altar as a sweet savour to the Lord, showing the priestly role in mediating worship.

questions.question: A family desires to cultivate humility and contentment in their daily work. How does the detailed care in preparing offerings in Leviticus 2 model these virtues?
options: Careful preparation of fine flour and oil without leaven shows reverence and contentment in obedience
Only the quantity of offering matters, not the preparation
Leaven is a symbol of humility and should be added
Offerings can be made carelessly as long as they come from the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Careful preparation of fine flour and oil without leaven shows reverence and contentment in obedience
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:4-7 shows detailed instructions on preparing offerings with fine flour and oil without leaven, illustrating how obedience and care in small details reflect humility and contentment in serving God.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 2, the remnant of the meat offering is considered most holy and belongs to Aaron and his sons.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:3 and 2:10 affirm that the leftover portion of the meat offering is most holy and belongs to Aaron and his sons, highlighting the respect and provision for priests in worship.

questions.question: When a believer faces trials that test their perseverance, how can the symbolism of the sweet savour made by fire in Leviticus 2 encourage faithfulness?
options: The offering made by fire produces a sweet savour to the LORD, symbolizing that faithful endurance pleases God
The fire destroys the offering, showing that trials have no value
Sweet savour refers only to physical fragrance and has no spiritual meaning
The offering is rejected if it is burnt
questions.correctAnswer: The offering made by fire produces a sweet savour to the LORD, symbolizing that faithful endurance pleases God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2, 2:9, and 2:16 describe offerings made by fire that produce a sweet savour to the LORD, illustrating that faithful obedience and endurance through trials are pleasing to God.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 2 model generosity and stewardship through the instructions about the meat offering leftovers?
options: The remnant belongs to the priests, indicating sharing and stewardship
All offerings must be burned with no leftovers
Leftovers should be discarded or given to strangers
The offerer keeps all leftovers for themselves
questions.correctAnswer: The remnant belongs to the priests, indicating sharing and stewardship
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:3 and 2:10 explain that the leftover meat offering is given to Aaron and his sons, showing a system of sharing and stewardship within the community of worship.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 2 allows honey to be burned on the altar as part of the meat offering.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 clearly states that no honey shall be burned in any offering made by fire to the LORD, emphasizing the requirement for purity in offerings.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how to present their firstfruits offering properly. According to Leviticus 2, what must be done with the firstfruits offering?
options: Offer green ears of corn dried by fire with oil and frankincense but do not burn the entire offering on the altar
Burn all firstfruits completely on the altar for a sweet savour
Offer firstfruits mixed with leaven and honey
Offer raw firstfruits with no seasoning
questions.correctAnswer: Offer green ears of corn dried by fire with oil and frankincense but do not burn the entire offering on the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:12-15 instructs that firstfruits are offered as green ears dried by fire, beaten out, anointed with oil and frankincense, but they are not completely burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

questions.question: How does the repeated instruction to include oil in the meat offering in Leviticus 2 teach about the role of the Holy Spirit in our spiritual life and service?
options: Oil symbolizes anointing and the presence of the Holy Spirit in worship and service
Oil is only for preservation and has no spiritual meaning
Oil is forbidden in offerings according to this chapter
Oil represents wealth and status in the offering
questions.correctAnswer: Oil symbolizes anointing and the presence of the Holy Spirit in worship and service
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1, 2:4-7, 2:15 emphasize pouring oil on the offerings, which biblically symbolizes anointing and the presence of the Holy Spirit empowering believers in worship and service.

questions.question: A believer asks how to maintain holiness in their daily work and offerings. What practical teaching from Leviticus 2 would you share about avoiding leaven in offerings?
options: Leaven represents corruption and must be excluded to maintain holiness
Leaven is a symbol of joy and should be included
Leaven is only forbidden in burnt offerings, not meat offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Leaven represents corruption and must be excluded to maintain holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 forbids leaven in any meat offering made by fire, symbolizing the need to exclude corruption and maintain holiness in worship and daily life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Leviticus 2, every oblation of your meat offering must be _______ with salt, which is the salt of the covenant of your God.
questions.correctAnswer: seasoned
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 teaches that all meat offerings must be seasoned with salt, representing the covenant between God and His people, stressing faithfulness and integrity.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 2 teach about the role of priests in the church and serving others?
options: Priests receive the remnant of offerings and burn a memorial portion on the altar
Priests must prepare all offerings themselves without the people's involvement
Priests do not participate in offerings
Priests only eat the offerings and do not present them
questions.correctAnswer: Priests receive the remnant of offerings and burn a memorial portion on the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2-3, 2:8-10 describe the priest's role in receiving offerings, burning a memorial portion on the altar, and taking the remainder, illustrating their service and mediation in worship.

questions.question: A believer is seeking biblical wisdom on presenting offerings with integrity. How does Leviticus 2 instruct about the preparation of meat offerings baked in different ways?
options: Offerings baked in the oven, pan, or frying pan must be unleavened and mixed with oil
Offerings can be leavened if baked in the oven
Offerings must be raw and not baked
questions.correctAnswer: Offerings baked in the oven, pan, or frying pan must be unleavened and mixed with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:4-7 specifies that meat offerings baked in various ways must be unleavened and mixed with oil, emphasizing purity, obedience, and consistency in worship.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 2.

questions.question: What ingredient is specifically forbidden in any meat offering presented to the LORD according to Leviticus 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Leaven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 explicitly forbids the use of leaven in meat offerings to the LORD, stating that no leaven shall be burned in offerings made by fire.

questions.question: In Leviticus 2, what is the purpose of salt in the meat offering?
options: To season the offering and symbolize the covenant
To act as a preservative only
To replace oil in the offering
To be burned as the main memorial
questions.correctAnswer: To season the offering and symbolize the covenant
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states that every meat offering shall be seasoned with salt and that it represents the salt of the covenant with God.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the type of flour used for the meat offerings in Leviticus 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 and subsequent verses consistently specify 'fine flour' as the ingredient for the meat offerings.

questions.question: How is frankincense used in the offerings described in Leviticus 2?
options: It is placed on top of the offering before burning
It is mixed into the flour
It is burned separately in a censer
It is excluded from the grain offerings
questions.correctAnswer: It is placed on top of the offering before burning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 and 2:15 mention that frankincense is placed upon the meat offering as part of the preparation before the priest burns a memorial portion.

questions.question: What does the priest do with the memorial portion of the meat offering according to Leviticus 2?
options: Burns it on the altar as an offering made by fire
Eats it in the holy place
Gives it back to the offerer
Pours it out at the base of the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Burns it on the altar as an offering made by fire
questions.explanation: Verses 2 and 9 emphasize that the priest burns a memorial portion of the meat offering on the altar as a sweet savor to the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 2, honey is allowed in meat offerings made by fire.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 prohibits the use of honey in any offering made by fire to the LORD.

questions.question: What is the significance of the meat offering being described as a "sweet savour unto the LORD" in Leviticus 2?
options: It symbolizes acceptance and pleasure by God
It refers to the literal smell of the offering
It means the offering is edible and tasty to men
It indicates the offering was made with spices
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes acceptance and pleasure by God
questions.explanation: The phrase 'sweet savour' (Hebrew 'reiach nichoach') is a common Old Testament expression indicating that the offering is pleasing and acceptable to God, as seen in verses 2 and 9.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 2, who receives the remainder of the meat offering after the memorial portion is burned?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 10 state that the remainder of the meat offering is given to Aaron and his sons because it is a holy thing.

questions.question: What types of baking methods for the meat offering are mentioned in Leviticus 2?
questions.correctAnswer: Oven, pan, frying pan
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:4-7 describe meat offerings baked in an oven, baked in a pan, and baked in a frying pan, each involving fine flour and oil.

questions.question: What is the role of oil in the meat offerings described in Leviticus 2?
options: It is poured upon the flour and used in preparation
It is used to anoint the priests only
It replaces salt in some offerings
It is forbidden in the offerings
questions.correctAnswer: It is poured upon the flour and used in preparation
questions.explanation: Verses 1, 4-7, and 15 show that oil is poured on the flour or cakes and is an integral part of the preparation of meat offerings.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "No meat offering which ye shall bring unto the LORD shall be made with ______."
questions.correctAnswer: leaven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 clearly states that no meat offering shall be made with leaven.

questions.question: What distinguishes the oblation of firstfruits meat offering in Leviticus 2 from other meat offerings?
options: It is not burnt on the altar for a sweet savour
It is offered only by kings
questions.correctAnswer: It is not burnt on the altar for a sweet savour
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:12 specifies that the oblation of the firstfruits is offered to the LORD but is not burnt on the altar as a sweet savour.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 2 foreshadow New Testament concepts of sacrifice?
options: The memorial portion burned symbolizes Christ’s atoning sacrifice
The flour represents the bread of life
The oil symbolizes the Holy Spirit’s anointing exclusively
Frankincense foreshadows the prayers of saints alone
questions.correctAnswer: The memorial portion burned symbolizes Christ’s atoning sacrifice
questions.explanation: The burnt memorial portion as a sweet savour offering (verses 2,9) typologically points to Christ’s perfect sacrifice in the New Testament, accepted by God as a pleasing offering.

questions.question: Which priestly descendants are responsible for receiving the remainder of the meat offerings?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron's sons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2 and 2:10 specify that the remainder of the meat offering belongs to Aaron and his sons, emphasizing their special priestly role.

questions.question: True or False: Green ears of corn dried by fire and beaten out of full ears are used in the firstfruits meat offering.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:14 describes that the firstfruits meat offering includes green ears of corn dried by fire and beaten out of full ears.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 2:1, what two substances are poured or put upon the fine flour in a meat offering to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Oil and frankincense
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:1 instructs that the offering of fine flour shall have oil poured upon it and frankincense put thereon. This symbolizes consecration and pleasing aroma to God. Similarly, Exodus 29:40 and Numbers 15:4-10 show the use of oil in offerings, while frankincense is a recurring symbol of prayer and holiness (Psalm 141:2; Revelation 8:3-4).

questions.question: Who is responsible for taking a handful of the flour, oil, and frankincense from the meat offering and burning it on the altar?
questions.correctAnswer: Aaron's sons the priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:2 states that Aaron's sons the priests take the handful of flour, oil, and frankincense and burn it on the altar as a memorial offering, showing the priestly mediation role (Hebrews 5:1-4; 7:23-28). This act signifies that the offering is made by fire, a sweet savour to the LORD.

questions.question: What happens to the remnant of the meat offering after the memorial portion is burned on the altar?
options: It is given to Aaron and his sons
It is eaten by the offerer
It is scattered in the fields
questions.correctAnswer: It is given to Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:3 explains that the remnant of the meat offering is most holy and belongs to Aaron and his sons, highlighting the priestly portion and God's provision for them (Numbers 18:8-32; 1 Corinthians 9:13-14). This shows the offering's sacredness and the sharing in God's covenant.

questions.question: What type of cakes are to be brought if the meat offering is baked in the oven, as described in Leviticus 2:4?
options: Unleavened cakes or wafers mixed or anointed with oil
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened cakes or wafers mixed or anointed with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:4 mandates that oven-baked meat offerings must be unleavened cakes or wafers mingled or anointed with oil, emphasizing purity and separation from corruption (Exodus 12:15; 1 Corinthians 5:7). Leaven often symbolizes sin and corruption, thus excluded.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 2:11, which ingredients are strictly forbidden in any meat offering made by fire to the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Leaven and honey
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11 forbids leaven and honey in meat offerings, as leaven symbolizes sin or corruption (1 Corinthians 5:6-8), and honey is associated with fermentation and impurity. This underscores the offering’s purity and holiness required before God.

questions.question: What covenant element must be included with every meat offering, according to Leviticus 2:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Salt
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 commands that every meat offering be seasoned with salt, symbolizing the 'salt of the covenant' between God and Israel (Numbers 18:19; 2 Chronicles 13:5). Salt represents preservation, purity, and the enduring nature of God's covenant (Mark 9:50).

questions.question: How is the meat offering of firstfruits to be prepared, as described in Leviticus 2:14?
options: Green ears of corn dried by fire and beaten out of full ears
questions.correctAnswer: Green ears of corn dried by fire and beaten out of full ears
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:14 specifies that firstfruits offerings include green ears of corn dried by fire and beaten from full ears, highlighting the dedication of the first and best to God (Exodus 23:19; Proverbs 3:9). This symbolizes dedication and thanksgiving for God's provision.

questions.question: What is the priest’s role regarding the memorial of the meat offering in Leviticus 2:16?
options: Burn part of the beaten corn, oil, and frankincense on the altar
Give it back to the offerer
Eat it in the holy place
questions.correctAnswer: Burn part of the beaten corn, oil, and frankincense on the altar
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:16 instructs the priest to burn the memorial portion of the beaten corn, oil, and frankincense, signifying a pleasing aroma to the LORD and God's acceptance (Hebrews 13:10-15). This act represents the offering’s dedication and mediation by the priest.

questions.question: What theological significance does the prohibition of leaven in meat offerings highlight in Leviticus 2:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Purity and separation from sin
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:11’s prohibition of leaven symbolizes the need for the offering and worshippers to be pure and separated from sin, reflecting God's holiness (1 Corinthians 5:7; Exodus 12:15). Leaven often symbolizes corruption or sin, so its exclusion points to Christ’s sinless sacrifice (Hebrews 9:14).

questions.question: What does the inclusion of frankincense in the meat offering symbolize in the context of worship as seen in Leviticus 2:1 and 2:15?
options: Prayer and the presence of God
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and the presence of God
questions.explanation: Frankincense in Leviticus 2:1 and 2:15 symbolizes the sweet aroma of prayer ascending to God (Psalm 141:2; Revelation 5:8). It represents the worshipper’s devotion and the acceptance of the offering, pointing forward to the intercession of Christ (Romans 8:34).

questions.question: Why is salt described as 'the salt of the covenant' in Leviticus 2:13, and what does its inclusion in offerings signify?
options: Perpetuity and preservation of God’s covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Perpetuity and preservation of God’s covenant
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:13 calls salt 'the salt of the covenant' signifying the enduring, preserving nature of God's covenant with His people (Numbers 18:19). Its inclusion in offerings symbolizes fidelity and the lasting relationship between God and Israel, reflecting the unchanging nature of God’s promises (2 Corinthians 1:20).

questions.question: In Leviticus 2:12, the oblation of the firstfruits is offered to the LORD but is not to be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour. What does this imply about firstfruits offerings?
options: They are reserved as a gift rather than burnt
They are to be eaten by the priests only
questions.correctAnswer: They are reserved as a gift rather than burnt
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:12 shows firstfruits offerings are dedicated to God but not burnt for a sweet savour, indicating they are a gift or dedication, not a sacrifice for atonement (Exodus 23:19; Deuteronomy 26:2). This points to the principle of giving God the first and best, reflecting gratitude and trust.

questions.question: Leviticus 2:8 says the meat offering made of these things is brought to the LORD and presented to the priest. What does this process reveal about the priest’s role in Israel’s worship?
options: The priest mediates between the offerer and God
The priest eats the entire offering
The priest decides the value of the offering
The priest offers sacrifices on behalf of other nations
questions.correctAnswer: The priest mediates between the offerer and God
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:8 emphasizes the priest’s mediatory role in presenting offerings to God, symbolizing the spiritual intercession and representation of the people before God (Hebrews 7:25; 1 Timothy 2:5). This typifies Christ’s ultimate priesthood mediating on behalf of believers.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 2:6, what must be done to a meat offering baked in a pan before it is presented to the LORD?
options: It shall be parted in pieces and oil poured on it
It shall be soaked in wine
It shall be mixed with honey
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be parted in pieces and oil poured on it
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:6 directs that the meat offering baked in a pan be divided into pieces and oil poured upon it, symbolizing consecration and dedication to God (Exodus 29:7; 1 Samuel 16:13). The anointing with oil represents the presence and blessing of the Holy Spirit (Psalm 23:5).

questions.question: What characteristic of the offerings described in Leviticus 2:10 and Leviticus 2:3 is emphasized by stating they are 'most holy'?
options: They are sanctified and set apart exclusively for God and the priests
They are intended only for the people
questions.correctAnswer: They are sanctified and set apart exclusively for God and the priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:3 and 2:10 call the remnant of the meat offerings 'most holy,' indicating their sanctification and exclusive dedication to God and His priests (Leviticus 21:8; Hebrews 7:26). This reflects the holiness required in worship and the mediatorial office of the priesthood.

questions.question: Leviticus 2:7 describes meat offerings baked in a frying pan. What is the essential ingredient and preparation mentioned?
questions.correctAnswer: Fine flour mixed with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 2:7 specifies that meat offerings baked in a frying pan must be made of fine flour with oil, maintaining the theme of purity and consecration (Exodus 29:2; Ezekiel 16:13). Oil signifies the anointing and presence of the Holy Spirit in worship (Luke 4:18).
